isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - WEST COAST MAGNUM MIRRORS AND AERO MIRRORS - AERO TUBULAR SERVICE PROCEDURES - MIRROR HEAD ASSEMBLY REBUILD

step1.para: Remove mirror shell, then remove mirror head from "C" loop (see Steps 1 and 2 above).
To remove flat glass mirror, push the top of the glass in, tilting it to expose the locking lever access opening on the bottom lip of the glass bezel.

Push the top of the glass in while reaching into the access opening and pushing the interface locking lever toward the outside edge of the mirror. This unlocks the glass. Remove the glass, disconnect the heater connectors on the reverse side.
To remove the flat glass actuator/adjuster, remove (3) mounting screws, remove the unit with its wire harness (if applicable) from the head.

To remove the convex mirror, slide finger tips behind the top of the mirror panel and pull out. Convex mirror will snap out of its mounting gimbal. Disconnect the heater connectors on the reverse side.
To remove the convex mirror mounting gimbal, remove (3) mounting screws and lift the unit from its mounting pedestals.
Disconnect heater wire harness from the mirror head.
To replace the convex mirror mounting gimbal, position it to its mounting pedestals and install (3) mounting screws.

To replace the convex glass, reconnect heater connectors on the reverse side, install (2) O-rings as shown in Figure 3, then lightly place and center the mirror on its gimbal mechanism. With equal pressure, snap the mirror onto its gimbal mechanism. Be sure the mirror has snapped into place and is secured to its gimbal mounting.

To replace the flat glass actuator/adjuster, push the wire harness connectors through the access hole in the mirror head, then position the unit by aligning the mounting holes. Install with (3) screws. Be sure the wire harness is fully extended on the reverse side of the head.

To replace flat glass, connect the heater connectors on the back of the mirror glass. Be sure the locking lever on the glass interface ring is all the way to the right, position the glass, align the interface ring on the glass back with the interface ring in the actuator/adjuster. With the interface rings aligned, rotate the locking lever to the left to lock the glass in place. Be sure the glass is locked onto the actuator/adjuster by indexing it up, down, right and left.
To install the mirror head to its C-loop, refer to Mirror Head Removal and Replacement, Steps 6 through 10.
Check all mirror functions prior to placing vehicle in service.
